## 1. Read in the data and inspect it with `plot()`

```{r}
data <- read.table("/home/anjrv/Projects/linear_statistical_models/data/bjor.csv", 
                   header = TRUE,
                   fill = FALSE,
                   sep = ";",
                   dec = ".",
                   na.strings = c("", " ", "NA"),
                   stringsAsFactors = TRUE)

plot(data)
```

## Fit a linear regression model using `lm()` and check the results with `summary()`

```{r}
lr <- lm(amagn~fjbjor, data)
summary(lr)
```

## Use `predict()` to predict the blood alcohol level after 4.5 beers.

```{r}
var_beer <- data.frame(fjbjor=c(4.5))
predict(lr, var_beer)
```
